Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: A rest area is 70 metres ahead
Do not stop for the next 70 metres

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

Answers.Answer: Only if there are vehicles in front of you
3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.
Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you are the driver and hurt somebody in a crash, who must you report it to?
Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
You are coming up to a school patrol crossing and both signs are held out. When can you drive on?

Answers.Answer: When both signs have been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on the crossing
When the sign on your side of the crossing has been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on your half of the crossing

Question: If you can do so safely, you may pass on the left at an intersection if:

Answers.Answer: you have the headlights of your vehicle turned on
the vehicle in front is signalling a left turn
the vehicle in front is signalling a right turn
the vehicle in front is going faster than the speed limit

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: If you miss your exit on a motorway, you should:

Answers.Answer: use the flush median strip and reverse back to the exit
make a U-turn back to the exit
drive on to the next exit
slowly stop and reverse back to the exit

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: As the holder of any class of driver licence you must carry your licence with you at all times when driving.
If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated

Question: What does this traffic signal mean?

Answers.Answer: Drive on before the signal changes to red
Drive on because the signal will turn green
Stop if you can do so safely
Stop only if traffic is in the way

Question: If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?
What is the safest way to carry goods inside a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: On the floor by the driver’s feet
On the shelf near the rear window

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What rule should you use to judge a safe following distance in wet or frosty conditions if driving a car?
What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass
